DataElement.preferredName: Tumor/Lesion Identification Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Diffuse Midline Glioma Present And Location Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator to describe whether diffused midline glioma present and if present, the location of the tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor/Lesion Identification Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Diffuse Midline Glioma Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the tumor/lesion identification domain.:A diffuse glioma that arises from the midline structures of the central nervous system. The majority of these tumors are found in the brainstem._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the tumor/lesion identification domain.

Concepts.definition: A diffuse glioma that arises from the midline structures of the central nervous system. The majority of these tumors are found in the brainstem.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Diffuse Midline Glioma Present And Location Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._A diffuse glioma that arises from the midline structures of the central nervous system. The majority of these tumors are found in the brainstem._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection._On the inside; contained in._The middle portion of the brainstem located between the midbrain and the medulla oblongata. The fourth ventricle lies dorsal to the pons which also contains the motor trigeminal nuclei and the abducens nuclei. The cerebellum contributes a large number of afferent fibers to the pons._The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

The middle portion of the brainstem located between the midbrain and the medulla oblongata. The fourth ventricle lies dorsal to the pons which also contains the motor trigeminal nuclei and the abducens nuclei. The cerebellum contributes a large number of afferent fibers to the pons.
The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes not centered in the pons

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone._[BI-RADS] a tiny spot of enhancement that is so small that it cannot otherwise be characterized; its shape and margins are not seen clearly enough to be described. in general, a focus is smaller than 5 mm._On the inside; contained in._The middle portion of the brainstem located between the midbrain and the medulla oblongata. The fourth ventricle lies dorsal to the pons which also contains the motor trigeminal nuclei and the abducens nuclei. The cerebellum contributes a large number of afferent fibers to the pons._The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.

[BI-RADS] a tiny spot of enhancement that is so small that it cannot otherwise be characterized; its shape and margins are not seen clearly enough to be described. in general, a focus is smaller than 5 mm.

The middle portion of the brainstem located between the midbrain and the medulla oblongata. The fourth ventricle lies dorsal to the pons which also contains the motor trigeminal nuclei and the abducens nuclei. The cerebellum contributes a large number of afferent fibers to the pons.
The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Diffuse Midline Glioma Present And Location Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A diffuse glioma that arises from the midline structures of the central nervous system.
